Class Question

java.lang.Object
main.Question
public class Question extends Object
Question class represents a question in the Question and Answer system. This class contains all the properties of a question including its ID, content, author information, and status.

Copyright: Team 60 CSE 360

Version:
1.00 2025-04-01 Question class implementation

  • Constructor Details

    • Question

      public Question(int id, String content, String author, Date timestamp, boolean answered)
      Creates a new Question with all properties.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the question
      content - The question text content
      author - Username of the question author
      timestamp - Time when the question was created
      answered - Whether the question has been marked as resolved

    • Question

      public Question(int id, String content, String author, Date timestamp)
      Creates a new Question marked as unresolved.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the question
      content - The question text content
      author - Username of the question author
      timestamp - Time when the question was created

    • Question

      public Question(int id, String content, String author, Date timestamp, Integer referenceQuestionId)
      Creates a new Question with reference to another question.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier for the question
      content - The question text content
      author - Username of the question author
      timestamp - Time when the question was created
      referenceQuestionId - ID of the question being referenced

      public boolean isAnswered()
      Checks if the question has been marked as resolved.
      Returns:
      true if the question has been resolved, false otherwise

    • hasReference

      public boolean hasReference()
      Checks if the question has a reference to another question.
      Returns:
      true if the question has a reference, false otherwise

    • validate

      public boolean validate()
      Validates the question content and author.
      Returns:
      true if the question has valid content and author, false otherwise
